item.title: Chime chases $11 billion valuation in IPO set for next week on Nasdaq
item.description: Crypto firm Circle is also going public with goals of a $7.2 billion valuation.

item.title: Syrian stock exchange reopens after a 6-month hiatus as part of U.S.-led push for a new free market economy
item.description: Stock trading resumed in Damascus after a six-month pause that began in December.

item.title: Gen Z men studying an MBA will see a 75% salary bump—that’s 25% more than women with the same qualification
item.description: Male MBA graduates make $36,000 more than their female counterparts and the disparity begins with their first job out of school.

item.title: The transformation of women’s sports in Saudi Arabia is no mirage. Just ask the women
item.description: Women were barred from stadiums prior to 2018. Today, there’s a premier women’s soccer league with global sponsorships.

item.title: Laurene Powell Jobs has the inside track on friend Jony Ive’s collaboration with OpenAI—but still wants to see Apple succeed
item.description: Ive says a driver for the io-OpenAI design is the fact that "humanity deserves better" than an "uneasy" relationship with technology.
